page.title: 05DURSLEY CARNIVAL
page.content: The annual Dursley Carnival procession assembles in the car park of Mawdsleys electrical engineering firm before making its way through the town centre to the recreation field. In 1985 the Carnival procession took place on the 15th June. The theme for this year was 'Fantasia' and the six decorated floats and about sixty walking entries depicted this theme by portraying 101 Dalmatians, Snow White, Ghostbusters and similar stories. As the procession wound its way along the crowd-lined roads in the bright sunshine spectators were able to see the result of the judging which had taken place at the assembly point.Winners in the various classes displayed appropriate cards. The procession included a steel band and a company of Majorettes.
